title: Ontology-Based Search System Training for Enhancing Behavioral Research Knowledge Processing Capabilities

context.prior_knowledge: Basic information retrieval skills and comprehension of mathematical research methodologies
context.additional_context: Situations requiring administrators to efficiently analyze math education research literature and apply it to practice. Targets learners familiar with digital environments but lacking experience with specialized search systems

learning_goals: Using an ontology-based search system, learners can accurately identify at least three core concepts (e.g., constructs, causal relationships) in behavioral research literature related to mathematics education.
By analyzing relationships between theories extracted via the search system, learners can derive at least two actionable insights applicable to their project topic.
Based on project outcomes, learners can evaluate the search systemâ€™s effectiveness in three aspects and propose improvement strategies.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
